metadata.name: Carbicarb Injection 1 G Injection powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used topically for dermatitides mouthwash vaginal douche veterinary use as emergency emetic Occasionally for dermatitides topically as a lotion Medication Vet In solution to cleanse skin in eczema to soften scabs of ringworm

contraindications.disease: Man LD50 Oral 714 mg kg Effect Behavioural General Anesthetic GI Ulceration or Bleeding from small intestine Mouse LC50 Inhalation 1200mg m3 2h GI Other Change Mouse LC50 Intraperitoneal 117mg kg Mouse LD50 Oral 6600mg kg Mouse LD50 Subcutaneous 2210 mg kg Rat LC50 Inhalation 2300mg m3 2H Rat LD50 Oral 4090 mg kg
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Alkalizing buffering action Sodium bicarbonate is an alkalinizing agent that dissociates to provide bicarbonate ion Bicarbonate in excess of that needed to buffer hydrogen ions causes systemic alkalinization and when excreted urine alkalinization as well Oral antacid action Taken orally sodium bicarbonate neutralizes stomach acid by the above mechanism
